content.description:
The four-bolt slab route on the right side of the domed slab. A short distinct crux above the second bolt, but lots of real friction climbing. Put up in 2008 or so, with a retro-rescrub in 2011 making it nice and clean.

About 50 feet right of Kids and Old Guys and about the same distance left of Bloody Finger. Also right above where the trail from the road reaches the base of the crag. Hard to miss.
Four bolts. Ring-bolt rap anchors on the ledge right of Sleeping Princess ledge.

This is the (currently very dirty) flake system with two bolts that runs up to the right of the scrambling approach to Pig Pen and sleeping Princess. Climb the curving flake crack and where it pinches out step left and jam up to the ledge below Sleeping Princess.

quite obvious low down as you approach the Great Expectations area.
Two bolts plus maybe a cam or wire

climbs.name: Off The Grid
climbs.fa: 10a (2 pts aid): D. Brayshaw 2012. FFA: B Herrington, M-A Leclerc 2014

content.description:
Very thin diagonal seams off the ledge past two bolts (boulder problem, 12-, or two A0 moves) lead to a right-facing layback that widens into a finger and hand crack. Where the crack dies out, step left and climb a blunt arete up dishes and edges to the top. 10a except for the boulder problem start.

Starts off the ledge atop Baby Steps and right of Sleeping Princess. Two bolt anchor on top. Can rap Sleeping princess or keep climbing up Tree Frog. Possible to link Baby Steps with this for one long 40m pitch.
4 bolts plus 2-3 pieces of finger sized gear for the crack

Technical sustained slab just to the right of Kids and Old Guys. Follow a spread out line of tiny pockets (big enough for 1 or 2 fingers) to the top. Starts spicy and maintains the heat until you reach a ledge about 3/4 of the way up.

TR can be setup by taking the ladder to the top of Kids and Old Guys and doing 1 move up Sleeping Princess Crack to step out right to the top of the dome to the right. Alternatively you can rappel from the top of Sleeping Princess to the top of the dome.

6 bolts used to protect the route, with a rap ring anchor at the top.

Climb the awkward fist crack left of Sleeping Princess. Gear to 3 inches.

See directions to Sleeping Princess (right hand side of the two cracks)
This route can be protected with larger cams or can be top roped by means of the two anchor bolts at the top. The bolts are reached the same way as the bolts for Sleeping Princess but instead of being below the chain the bolts are above and left of the chain.

Climb the technical slab from left to right to join up with Pig Pen. Climb Pig Pen to a good ledge where you traverse right and finish with the crux of Sleeping Princess.

There is a blind placement made from the ledge into the Sleeping Princess crack.

See Sleeping Princess.
Gear up to 3". A really good spot for the slab portion, and I would recommend using the tree to anchor the belayer.

Sleeping Princess is the right-hand crack at the two cracks at the bottom of the bluffs! It is a nice solid granite crack and is easy to protect, the crux is at the last 10ft of the climb where the dihedral peeters out. This is a good warm-up climb and is much easier than the Left-Crack. The main trail in the directions to the bluffs will take you to the bottom of the two cracks, there is a short fixed rope to reach the bottom of the climbs.
To hike to the TR anchors take the trail to the left of the cracks. When the hill becomes less steep head directly to your right on the path until you reach the tree with a fixed rope attached to it. Descend the rope to reach the chain. Cams in the thin hand to wide hand range...

Climb the first few moves of Sleeping Princess and stem out right to a rail that becomes a good ledge. Mantle on the rail. Make a cruxy dyno or very long static reach to a good hold from a crimper. Continue up face features to join the last two bolts of Off The Grid. The 10+ grade given here is a very rough approximation of the dyno difficulty which might be V2 or so as a boulder problem? Suggest your idea of a proper YDS grade when you climb it. Just right of Sleeping Princess. Joins the top of Off The Grid. In your face and hard to miss as you approach the crag.

Two bolt anchor on top, no rap anchor yet. Can traverse to and rap Sleeping Princess to get down. 5 bolts. Optional 2" piece for starting moves of Sleeping Princess.
Climbs on and around the parallel cracks of Sleeping Princess and Pig Pen
